content:
• Monday, July 23, 2012
  • VLTR

    More on Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Shares are getting slammed in after hours trade,...

    More on Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Shares are getting slammed in after hours trade, now down over 15% after coming up short on Q2 estimates across the board. The company blames a challenging macro economic environment and curtailed orders from customers for the shortfall. Separately, the company announced a $15M expansion of its existing share repurchase program.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 PM
  • SANM

    Sanmina-SCI (NASDAQ:SANM) +12.3% AH after posting a mixed FQ3 report, but guiding for FQ4...

    Sanmina-SCI (NASDAQ:SANM) +12.3% AH after posting a mixed FQ3 report, but guiding for FQ4 revenue of $1.575B-$1.625B, above a $1.53B consensus. EPS is expected to come in at $0.32-$0.38, in-line with a $0.34 consensus. Sanmina shares have been beaten down on an assortment of macro, IT spending, and telecom capex worries. Fellow contract manufacturers such as FLEX, JBL, and PLXS could rally tomorrow in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 6:04 PM
  • CMLP

    Crestwood Midstream (NYSE:CMLP) -3.9% AH after saying it expects to report reductions in Q2...

    Crestwood Midstream (NYSE:CMLP) -3.9% AH after saying it expects to report reductions in Q2 gathering volumes, to ~560MMcf/day vs. 611MMcf/day in Q1 on production-related factors, and FY2012 earnings, seeing adjusted EBITDA of $125M-$130M vs. prior guidance of $135M-$140M. CMLP also says it will acquire certain Barnett Shale assets from Devon Energy (NYSE:DVN) for $90M.

     
     
     
     
    | 5:54 PM | 1 Comment
  • PFE

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) says an experimental Alzheimer's treatment it's working on with Johnson &...

    Pfizer (NYSE:PFE) says an experimental Alzheimer's treatment it's working on with Johnson & Johnson (NYSE:JNJ) unit Janssen Pharmaceuticals did not meet clinical endpoints in a late-stage study. In the study, patients with mild-to-moderate Alzheimer's disease given an intravenous form of the drug bapineuzumab didn't fare any better in cognitive and functional performance than those given a placebo. Elan (NYSE:ELN), which holds a 49.9% equity interest in Janssen Alzheimer Immunotherapy, is taking a big hit after hours: PFE -1.3%, JNJ -0.2%, ELN -16.8%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:33 PM | 1 Comment
  • BIDU

    More on Baidu's Q2: 352K online ad customers, +9.7% Q/Q and +18.1% Y/Y. Revenue/customer was...

    More on Baidu's Q2: 352K online ad customers, +9.7% Q/Q and +18.1% Y/Y. Revenue/customer was $2,440, +16.5% Q/Q and +34.8% Y/Y. Traffic acquisition costs were 8.3% of revenue, up from 7.8% in Q1 and 7.9% in year-ago period. SG&A expenses +55.6% Y/Y, R&D expenses +82.7%. BIDU +5.5% AH. Up in sympathy: SINA +2.8%. SOHU +2.5%. YOKU +1.7%. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:42 PM
  • VLTR

    Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $43.6M (+4.5%...

    Volterra Semiconductor (NASDAQ:VLTR): Q2 EPS of $0.32 misses by $0.02. Revenue of $43.6M (+4.5% Y/Y) misses by $0.7M. Shares -5.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:31 PM
  • WP

    Vantiv (VNTV): Q2 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $260.4M (+20.1% Y/Y) beats by $13M....

    Vantiv (VNTV): Q2 EPS of $0.32 beats by $0.04. Revenue of $260.4M (+20.1% Y/Y) beats by $13M. Shares -5% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:30 PM
  • TWX

    Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) -3.5% today as the movie industry scales back expectations for The Dark...

    Time Warner (NYSE:TWX) -3.5% today as the movie industry scales back expectations for The Dark Knight Rises after Friday's Colorado shooting spree. Weekend reports said the film made ~$160M in its first three days, nothing to sneeze at but lower than earlier projections. Warner Bros. was not among film studios releasing weekend box-office results by the market close.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:27 PM
  • ATGE

    DeVry (DV) lowers its FQ4 earnings forecast, now seeing EPS of $0.43-$0.46 on revenue of...

    DeVry (DV) lowers its FQ4 earnings forecast, now seeing EPS of $0.43-$0.46 on revenue of $500M-$510M vs. consensus EPS estimates of $0.78 on revenue of $516M. Management blames the shortfall on the increased use of scholarships awarded to students in its May and July classes and higher than anticipated operating costs. Shares are getting pounded, -21% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM
  • VMW

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.12B (+22% Y/Y) in-line with...

    VMware (NYSE:VMW): Q2 EPS of $0.68 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $1.12B (+22% Y/Y) in-line with consensus and preliminary results. Expects Q3 revenue of $1.11B-$1.15B vs. $1.14B consensus. Company is also announcing the acquisition of switch software developer Nicira for $1.05B in cash + $210M in unvested equity. Shares -3.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM
  • BIDU

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q2 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $858.8M (+59.8% Y/Y) beats by...

    Baidu (NASDAQ:BIDU): Q2 EPS of $1.26 beats by $0.14. Revenue of $858.8M (+59.8% Y/Y) beats by $8M. Expects Q3 revenue of $983M-$1.01B vs. $988M consensus. Shares +6.6% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:05 PM | 5 Comments
  • GEVO

    Gevo (GEVO -1.8%) shares sink to an all-time low after the U.S. government agreed to review a...

    Gevo (GEVO -1.8%) shares sink to an all-time low after the U.S. government agreed to review a key patent, responding to a request from Butamax Advanced Biofuels; the two companies are involved in several patent lawsuits. "Re-examinations are part of the normal course of a patent dispute," Gevo says in response.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM
  • CVC

    BofA Merrill Lynch says its sees potential upside for Cablevision (CVC +0.3%) from Dish...

    BofA Merrill Lynch says its sees potential upside for Cablevision (CVC +0.3%) from Dish Network's Voom litigation. It ups the shares to Buy, adding that the company should also benefit over the near term from other catalysts as well, including its high dividend yield and attractive valuation.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM
  • CLD

    Cloud Peak Energy (CLD +2.6%) and the Crow Tribe of Indians reach agreement regarding...

    Cloud Peak Energy (CLD +2.6%) and the Crow Tribe of Indians reach agreement regarding exploration rights and exclusive options to lease and develop up to 1.4B tons of in-place coal near CLD's Northern Powder River Basin properties in Montana.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM
  • CEI

    An internal review of Lucas Energy’s (LEI +11.1%) Eagle Ford properties shows as much as...

    An internal review of Lucas Energy’s (LEI +11.1%) Eagle Ford properties shows as much as 14.5M bbl/day of oil, a big boost from its previous estimate of 3.7M bbl/day. The new estimate would take LEI’s Eagle Ford value to more than $275M, a useful number to evaluate offers by potential buyers or to assist in any decision of whether to develop or sell properties.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • AKRX

    Akorn (AKRX -8%) gets pummeled on a Deutsche downgrade to Hold, citing its high valuation, a...

    Akorn (AKRX -8%) gets pummeled on a Deutsche downgrade to Hold, citing its high valuation, a lack of exclusivity for a generic version of Abbott's (ABT -0.6%) Prometrium, and a weaker than expected Vancomycin launch. The firm also cuts its price target to $14 from $15.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 1 Comment
  • MAN

    BofA Merrill Lynch cuts its price target for Manpower (MAN -3.6%) to $45 from $54,...

    BofA Merrill Lynch cuts its price target for Manpower (MAN -3.6%) to $45 from $54, primarily on a slowdown in Europe and assuming that macro headwinds "intensify." The firm says it likes the long-term risk/reward profile for the temp employment agency, which reported Q2 earnings Friday, but that investors should expect near-term volatility.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM
  • STRI

    Shares of STR Holdings (STRI -4.8%) slide after the company lowered its Q2 revenue projection...

    Shares of STR Holdings (STRI -4.8%) slide after the company lowered its Q2 revenue projection earlier today on softer-than-anticipated demand for its solar encapsulants. It now expects revenue of around $25M, down from its prior view of $31M to $33M. It also said it expects to break even on the bottom line, which is at the bottom end of its previous estimate of flat to $0.02 per share.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM
  • ZNGA

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.3%) isn't letting a tech selloff keep it from bouncing ahead of Wednesday's Q2...

    Zynga (ZNGA +5.3%) isn't letting a tech selloff keep it from bouncing ahead of Wednesday's Q2 report. A suddenly depressed valuation and heavy short interest (21.9% of Zynga's float was shorted as of June 29) make for a volatile mix. The Street will be paying close attention to Zynga's Q2 daily active user and unique payer counts, given signs growth has stalled thanks to tough competition and a shift towards mobile gaming.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:48 PM
  • OSGB

    Oil transporters take a beating as low rates, lower fuel consumption and a tanker glut continue...

    Oil transporters take a beating as low rates, lower fuel consumption and a tanker glut continue to dissuade investors. Tanker rates are averaging less than $5K/day, a far cry from the $25K-$30K that Overseas Shipholding (OSG -5.8%) and Frontline (FRO -3.8%) need to break even, Jefferies says: "These companies are losing money and unable to cover cash costs."

     
     
     
     
    | 2:47 PM | 2 Comments
  • SVNTQ

    Shares of Savient Pharmaceutical (SVNT +37%) spike higher following a favorable Court ruling...

    Shares of Savient Pharmaceutical (SVNT +37%) spike higher following a favorable Court ruling granting both of Savient's motions in the lawsuit brought against the Company by Tang Capital Partners other convertible note holders. The Court ruled that there hasn't been any default on SVNT's convertible notes, nor can the plaintiff noteholders can't appoint a receiver because they have no standing. The Court has not yet decided on the plaintiff's claims for breach of fiduciary duty and waste.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:40 PM
  • VIAV

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -6.3%) is among the day's biggest tech losers. Benzinga notes put buyers have...

    JDS Uniphase (JDSU -6.3%) is among the day's biggest tech losers. Benzinga notes put buyers have been aggressive, with over 8K August $8 contracts purchased this morning. JDS just announced it will deliver its FQ4 report on August 14 - a pretty late date for a quarter that closed on June 30. Its shares were hammered this month by bad earnings news from telecom equipment vendors, but rallied a little on Friday thanks to Verizon's capex guidance.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:37 PM
  • EQM

    Coverage of EQT Midstream (EQM +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy at BofA and ratings ranging...

    Coverage of EQT Midstream (EQM +2.4%) is initiated with a Buy at BofA and ratings ranging from Outperform to Hold at four other firms (I, II, III, IV). A typical reaction comes from Deutsche Bank, which says "substantial drop-down opportunities" from parent EQT as well as EQM's organic value-enhancing projects support a double-digit distribution growth rate for several years.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:28 PM
  • GNC

    GNC Holdings (GNC -1.2%) shares slip after its board appoints CEO Joe Fortunato to replace...

    GNC Holdings (GNC -1.2%) shares slip after its board appoints CEO Joe Fortunato to replace Norman Axelrod as Chairman. The stock touched $35.50 before buyers emerged at near support dating back to the middle of June.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM
  • TOSBF

    Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF) plans to slash NAND flash memory production by 30% due to demand worries,...

    Toshiba (OTCPK:TOSBF) plans to slash NAND flash memory production by 30% due to demand worries, The Nikkei reports. The report is helping NAND partner SanDisk (SNDK +2.8%) add to the big gains it saw on Friday thanks to its Q3 guidance, as investors hope Toshiba's move will lead to higher prices and lower capex. Solid-state drive vendor OCZ Technology (OCZ +1%) is also higher, though SanDisk/Toshiba rival Micron (MU -2.8%) is following the market lower.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:05 PM
  • MDC

    Homebuilders buck today's downtrend as Goldman upgrades the homebuilder sector to Attractive and...

    Homebuilders buck today's downtrend as Goldman upgrades the homebuilder sector to Attractive and raises its ratings for MDC +5.6%, KBH +2.1% and RYL +4% while cutting NVR -1.8% to Sell. The firm thinks "investors should take advantage of the likely volatility in the space given U.S. homebuilders' strong correlation with the still depressed levels of new home sales."

     
     
     
     
    | 1:59 PM | 1 Comment
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX 0.9%) trades up today despite a bleak overall market on a Leerink upgrade to...

    Luminex (LMNX 0.9%) trades up today despite a bleak overall market on a Leerink upgrade to Outperform from Market Perform, citing the company's acquisition of GenturaDx and expectations for FDA clearance of its gastrointestinal pathogen panel.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:55 PM
  • WTSL

    Shareholder Clinton Group calls on the board of Wet Seal (WTSLA -11.5%) to sell the company,...

    Shareholder Clinton Group calls on the board of Wet Seal (WTSLA -11.5%) to sell the company, expecting a sale could bring shareholders $5-$8/share, given recent transaction multiples and premiums in the retailing industry. Earlier today, the women's apparel retailer fired its CEO after same-store sales fell for 11 months in a row.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:40 PM
  • DECK

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.8%) take a beating today after Sterne Agee cut it to...

    Shares of Deckers Outdoor (DECK -6.8%) take a beating today after Sterne Agee cut it to Underperform due to anticipated lower FY guidance when it reports next week. The firm doesn't expect Asian and European sales to improve and for U.S. sales to be impacted by higher prices and lack of innovation in the UGG Classic segment. Price target cut to $38.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • TECK

    Teck Resources (TCK -3.8%) reportedly is looking for a new partner for its Quebrada Blanca...

    Teck Resources (TCK -3.8%) reportedly is looking for a new partner for its Quebrada Blanca copper mine in Chile as a minority shareholder seeks to sell its stake. TCK controls a 76.5% stake in the mine, which last year produced ~63K metric tons of copper with a planned $5.6B expansion, production would increase to 250K tons/year during the first five years.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • AIG

    AIG (AIG -1.8%) reportedly is negotiating to buy the Woodbury independent broker-dealer business...

    AIG (AIG -1.8%) reportedly is negotiating to buy the Woodbury independent broker-dealer business from Hartford (HIG -1.9%), an insurance rival that's divesting several businesses. The possible transaction comes as Hartford has faced criticism from big shareholder John Paulson, which over the past year has demanded HIG take action to improve its stock price.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:08 PM

  • The VIX fear index is +16.3% at 18.92, although that's down from 20.49 earlier, and one ETF...

    The VIX fear index is +16.3% at 18.92, although that's down from 20.49 earlier, and one ETF trader isn't too bothered by the spike. "The move looks ugly, the graphs of the futures look ugly, but it's not that big of a move at all," he says. For perspective, the VIX is well down from its 52-week high of 48 almost a year ago.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:01 PM
  • E

    Russia's Rosneft signs an agreement with Italy's Eni (E -4%) to finance exploration at two...

    Russia's Rosneft signs an agreement with Italy's Eni (E -4%) to finance exploration at two offshore fields in the Arctic and one in the Black Sea, advancing a cooperation deal signed in April. Eni's investment will be returned from the project's cash flows once production is launched. Rosneft recently has signed a number of deals with foreign firms, including XOM and STO.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:58 PM
  • SGYP

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP 3%) moves up after acquiring Callisto Pharmaceuticals, a...

    Synergy Pharmaceuticals (SGYP 3%) moves up after acquiring Callisto Pharmaceuticals, a development stage bio-pharmaceutical company focused primarily on the development of drugs to treat GI disorders and diseases.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:54 PM
  • HAL

    Halliburton's (HAL +1.7%) Q2 earnings slipped but shares are up as analysts were bracing for...

    Halliburton's (HAL +1.7%) Q2 earnings slipped but shares are up as analysts were bracing for gloomy results in the face of the global economic slowdown but pleasantly surprised to see growth abroad and stability at home. "The international business overall is robust and growing," mirroring results at SLB -0.9% and BHI +1.1%, Barclays says. "The companies are now seeing good volume growth."

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • FCX

    The Indonesian government asks Freeport McMoRan (FCX -4.4%) to reduce its stake in its...

    The Indonesian government asks Freeport McMoRan (FCX -4.4%) to reduce its stake in its Indonesian unit through an IPO on the local stock market to less than 50%, and to pay higher royalties on its big Grasberg mine. The government seeks to renegotiate "unfair" mining contracts signed prior to passage of a 2009 mining law.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM | 4 Comments
  • ETN

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton Corp. (ETN 4.6%) trades higher after beating consensus...

    Diversified industrial manufacturer Eaton Corp. (ETN 4.6%) trades higher after beating consensus estimates on its Q2 EPS this morning. Net earnings rose 14% Y/Y on acquisition-related growth, though revenue declined due to currency rate fluctuations and lower-than-expected market growth.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM

  • European shares close lower as fears over Spain and Greece return with a vengeance. Euro Stoxx...

    European shares close lower as fears over Spain and Greece return with a vengeance. Euro Stoxx 50 -2.65%, London -2.1%, Paris -2.9%, Frankfurt -3.2%, Milan -3%, Madrid -1.2%, although up from earlier lows. 10-year bond yields: Spain +21 bps to 7.48%, Italy +20 bps to 6.36%, Germany +1 bps to 1.18%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:58 AM | 2 Comments
  • MCPIQ

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -5.6%) hit a 52-week low as the WTO reportedly launches an investigation...

    Shares of Molycorp (MCP -5.6%) hit a 52-week low as the WTO reportedly launches an investigation into China’s export quotas and tariffs on rare earths, tungsten and molybdenum. The average Chinese export price of rare earth oxides soared 537% in 2011 vs. 2010 and was 10% higher Y/Y in the first five months of 2012, according to Bloomberg data. REE -3.7%, AVL -1.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:57 AM
  • CHFS

    Shares of Sunshine Heart (SSH +18%) jump this morning after announcing it's completed a two-year...

    Shares of Sunshine Heart (SSH +18%) jump this morning after announcing it's completed a two-year follow-up for a feasibility trial involving a patient that was implanted with its C-Pulse Heart Assist System. This was the first patient to reach two-year follow-up in the trial, which showed no neurological events and a statistically significant improvement in the patient's quality of life.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:45 AM
  • MRO

    Marathon Oil (MRO -2.6%) expands into Kenya by entering into a farmout agreement with Africa Oil...

    Marathon Oil (MRO -2.6%) expands into Kenya by entering into a farmout agreement with Africa Oil to acquire an interest in two onshore exploration blocks amounting to more than 11M gross acres. MRO will pay $35M to buy a 50% working interest in Block 9 and a 15 percent stake in Block 12A in northwest Kenya. The companies also agree to pursue exploration activities in Ethiopia.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • CEO

    While Cnooc’s (CEO -3.7%) past attempt at a big North American deal fell apart - its 2005...

    While Cnooc’s (CEO -3.7%) past attempt at a big North American deal fell apart - its 2005 bid for Unocal - analysts so far show cautious optimism the Nexen (NXY +51.2%) deal can go through, with several seeing Canada as more willing than the U.S. to approve a deal. “Cnooc did a nice job in adding oil reserves at less than US$20/bbl,” one analyst says. “It’s really a good time to buy assets."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • SPRD

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.5%) rallies following a report claiming it has secured a number of design...

    Spreadtrum (SPRD +3.5%) rallies following a report claiming it has secured a number of design wins for Samsung TD-SCDMA 3G phones that will be sold by China Mobile. Digitimes adds the design wins have come at the expense of archrival MediaTek, and that Spreadtrum has a lead on MediaTek in developing quad-core processors and 4G baseband chips. Marvell (NASDAQ:MRVL) is also a major rival in the TD-SCDMA market. The report comes as Spreadtrum announces a design win for a Huawei phone.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM
  • MCD

    From the McDonald's (MCD -2.2%) conference call: The company says its seeing stronger headwinds...

    From the McDonald's (MCD -2.2%) conference call: The company says its seeing stronger headwinds on its top and bottom lines, particularly out of Europe. ( View webcast )
     
     
     
     
    | 11:12 AM | 1 Comment
  • GALT

    Microcap drug developer Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +68%) soars after being granted a patent for...

    Microcap drug developer Galectin Therapeutics (GALT +68%) soars after being granted a patent for its Galactose-prolonged polysaccharides, a carbohydrate-based galectin inhibitor compound for use in patients with chronic liver disease associated with the development of fibrosis, established liver fibrosis or end-stage scarring, or cirrhosis.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:05 AM | 2 Comments
  • CVX

    Chevron (CVX -2%) says its Pontus-1 exploration well in the Greater Gorgon area off the coast of...

    Chevron (CVX -2%) says its Pontus-1 exploration well in the Greater Gorgon area off the coast of western Australia encountered 97 feet of net gas pay: "The Pontus-1 discovery again highlights Chevron's exploration success as we continue building a significant natural gas position in Western Australia to supply Australia and the Asia-Pacific region."

     
     
     
     
    | 11:04 AM
  • TLB

    Talbots (TLB +2.9%) says the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation won't take action related to...

    Talbots (TLB +2.9%) says the Pension Benefit Guaranty Corporation won't take action related to the retailer's acquisition by private-equity firm Sycamore Partners, following the two company's revision to their merger agreement on Friday. The new amendment deletes the financing proceeds as a condition to purchaser's tender offer to acquire all of the outstanding shares of the Company's common stock, and the PGBC's agreement paves the way for the deal to close.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:58 AM
  • CREE

    Cree (CREE -4.6%) is getting hit by cautious comments from Needham about the rate of LED...

    Cree (CREE -4.6%) is getting hit by cautious comments from Needham about the rate of LED lighting adoption. The firm has lowered its PT to $28, though that's well above Cree's current price of $22.75. LED lighting prices have fallen dramatically in the last two years, and the declines are expected to continue. However, prices remain well above those for comparable fluorescent solutions.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM
  • NRG

    At 6.3x GenOn's (GEN +25.8%) estimated 2013 EBITDA, NRG's (NRG +8.3%) merger with GenOn was...

    At 6.3x GenOn's (GEN +25.8%) estimated 2013 EBITDA, NRG's (NRG +8.3%) merger with GenOn was completed at an attractive price, Wunderlich says; ~$200M of operating cost savings are expected, with an additional $100M of interest and capital cost savings. Barclays upgrades NRG to Overweight with a $22 price target, up from $19. (also)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:49 AM | 2 Comments
  • HAS

    More on Hasbro (HAS +3.1%) Q2: net profit slumps 25% to $43.4M as sales fall across all major...

    More on Hasbro (HAS +3.1%) Q2: net profit slumps 25% to $43.4M as sales fall across all major segments. The boys segment suffered the most following a strong showing last year for "Transformers" and "Beyblade." Profitability in the U.S. and Canada improved, due to a better product mix and inventory. Reiterates it expects to improve revenues and EPS this year, excluding the effects of forex.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:40 AM
  • PETS

    Retail pet-pharmacy PetMed Express (PETS -12.1%) gets slammed after its FQ1 comes up short of...

    Retail pet-pharmacy PetMed Express (PETS -12.1%) gets slammed after its FQ1 comes up short of expectations this morning. Net income fell 18% Y/Y as a decline in average order size weighed on bottom-line sales numbers.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:27 AM

  • It's not just Spanish 10-year bond yields that are soaring (+23 bps to 7.49%), the 2-year yield...

    It's not just Spanish 10-year bond yields that are soaring (+23 bps to 7.49%), the 2-year yield is +77.5 bps to 6.53%. WSB commenter Old Trader notes Spain had been selling 2 yr. debt to skirt the "punishing 10 yr. rates." MarketBeat writes that the flattening yield curve suggests "investors are increasing their bets that some kind of default could occur or the economic outlook looks like it could worsen."
     
     
     
     
    | 10:23 AM | 3 Comments
  • P

    Like some other Internet names, Pandora (P -4.9%) is falling hard. Rival Spotify announced over...

    Like some other Internet names, Pandora (P -4.9%) is falling hard. Rival Spotify announced over the weekend U.S. users had listened to over 13B tracks through its service in the 12 months following its U.S. launch, and that 27.8B tracks had been shared (many of them via Facebook's Open Graph). Pandora, for its part, reported this morning its cumulative audience in the coveted 18-49 demographic rose 6% from March to June, to 25.3M listeners (per Triton Research).
     
     
     
     
    | 10:13 AM | 5 Comments
  • NRG

    Energy names may be suffering, but NRG Energy (NYSE:NRG) is +7.2% following news of its $1.7B...

    Energy names may be suffering, but NRG Energy (NYSE:NRG) is +7.2% following news of its $1.7B purchase of GenOn Energy (GEN +24.2%). "Another great acquisition for NRG, with announced synergy value paying for 67% of deal equity cost," says Tudor Pickering Holt. NRG also declared its first ever quarterly dividend.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:10 AM
  • DECK

    Deckers (DECK -5.9%) slumps towards its 52-week low after receiving a downgrade to Underperform...

    Deckers (DECK -5.9%) slumps towards its 52-week low after receiving a downgrade to Underperform from Sterne Agee. The firm, which had upgraded Deckers in April on valuation grounds, is lowering its target for the shoemaker to $38 from $60. Deckers delivers its Q2 report on Thursday.
